result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Resitution due by payment plan of $50 per month beginning 10-17-14. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Best image.

Defendant Melvin  Wilson in court with attorney Martin R Tanz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed.  State files amended Information. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence. Jury trial removed from court calendar. Restitution due by payment plan. Court costs waived.
Amended
Call from Atty Tanz stating change of plea to be entered 4/21/14.
Call with Atty Tanz. He believes 2 days needed for trial. DA's office advises 1 day will be sufficient.
Voice message left for Atty Tanz to contact clerk and advise if matter will be a 1 or 2 day jury trial.

Defendant Melvin Wilson in court with attorney Martin Tanz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:04am Deputy Matthew Haas sworn and testified. State rests subject to rebuttal. No witnesses by defense. Statement by the State. Defense moves to dismiss. Based on testimony given the Court finds probable cause. Court informs. Counsel wavies reading and enters not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Melvin Wilson in court with attorney Martin Tanz.  Defendant in custody. Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests cash bond in the amount of $5000, defense requests signature bond.   Court orders $1000 cash bond, no contact with AH.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, time limits also waived, defendant requests a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
